match.title: 4th ODI
match.statusText: Afghanistan won by 3 wickets (with 20 balls remaining)
match.hoursInfo: 09.30 start, First Session 09.30-13.00 Interval 13.00-13.45, Second Session 13.45-17.00

dismissalText.long: c Samiullah Shinwari b Dawlat Zadran
dismissalText.commentary: Sikandar Raza c Samiullah Shinwari b Dawlat Zadran 86 (113b 5x4 1x6 133m) SR: 76.1

dismissalComment.html: sliced up high towards mid off, the fielder runs back, settles underneath it, and holds the catch. A brave knock comes to an end.

headshotImage.caption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Chamu Chibhabha lbw b Rashid Khan 26 (32b 4x4 0x6 64m) SR: 81.25

dismissalComment.html: got him! This has been a lovely over from the young leggie. Again he hung this one in the breeze, and it drifted in deceptively. He expected it to pitch and turn, but it rushed straight on, and he'd played outside it. Umpire Nigel Llong upholds the appeal, and Zimbabwe are in serious trouble at 45 for 4.

trapped in front! Mutumbami stayed at the crease, his feet didn't really go anywhere, and flicked across his front pad. There were two sounds, but I believe that was the ball hitting the front pad and and the back pad. A fairly straightforward decision for the umpire, and Afghanistan strike early!

got him! After beating the bat twice, Dawlat has found the edge. Ervine wanted to drive again. The ball was up there for the shot, but the seam movement took it further away from him. The ball kissed the edge and nestled snuggly in Shahzad's gloves. Dawlat is embraced by his team mates as he pumps his fists in celebration.
sliced up high towards mid off, the fielder runs back, settles underneath it, and holds the catch. A brave knock comes to an end.

headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

image.caption: Tinotenda Mutombodzi at the Under-19 World Cup
image.longCaption: Tinotenda Mutombodzi at the Under-19 World Cup, January 2010

dismissalComment.html: stumped! Tino came down the track, but the ball was really short and he couldn't get close to the pitch of it. There was sharp spin, away from the bat, and by the time he turned himself around Shahzad had smashed the stumps down. Another one goes, and Zimbabwe sink even further

dismissalComment.html: trapped in front! Mutumbami stayed at the crease, his feet didn't really go anywhere, and flicked across his front pad. There were two sounds, but I believe that was the ball hitting the front pad and and the back pad. A fairly straightforward decision for the umpire, and Afghanistan strike early!

dismissalText.long: c Mohammad Shahzad b Dawlat Zadran
dismissalText.commentary: Craig Ervine c Mohammad Shahzad b Dawlat Zadran 1 (9b 0x4 0x6 9m) SR: 11.11

dismissalComment.html: got him! After beating the bat twice, Dawlat has found the edge. Ervine wanted to drive again. The ball was up there for the shot, but the seam movement took it further away from him. The ball kissed the edge and nestled snuggly in Shahzad's gloves. Dawlat is embraced by his team mates as he pumps his fists in celebration.

dismissalText.long: c Nawroz Mangal b Amir Hamza
dismissalText.commentary: Sean Williams c Nawroz Mangal b Amir Hamza 11 (22b 0x4 1x6 27m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: chipped to mid off! Williams probably wanted to go straighter than this, but punched too early at the ball to present a simple catch to the mid off fielder.

headshotImage.caption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: got him! This has been a lovely over from the young leggie. Again he hung this one in the breeze, and it drifted in deceptively. He expected it to pitch and turn, but it rushed straight on, and he'd played outside it. Umpire Nigel Llong upholds the appeal, and Zimbabwe are in serious trouble at 45 for 4.

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Elton Chigumbura run out (Shafiqullah/Mohammad Shahzad) 15 (46b 1x4 0x6 45m) SR: 32.6

dismissalComment.html: a needless run out! Raza tapped the ball just wide of mid on, but called immediately for the single. He was running to the danger end, so it was his call. Chigumbura must have heard the call, but he turned around and watched the ball instead of running. By the time he eventually set off, with Raza shouting for the single again, the ball was already being thrown to Shahzad. Ball-watching results in a run out.

dismissalText.long: c Samiullah Shinwari b Mohammad Nabi
dismissalText.commentary: Luke Jongwe c Samiullah Shinwari b Mohammad Nabi 22 (38b 1x4 0x6 61m) SR: 57.89

dismissalComment.html: slog swept out to deep midwicket! Well, he went for the shot straight away. The connection was alright, but it went too high and not far enough. The fielder settles under the high chance, and holds it cleanly.

headshotImage.caption: Tendai Chisoro player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tendai Chisoro player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Shahzad c Sikandar Raza b Chisoro 80 (81b 7x4 3x6 98m) SR: 98.76

dismissalComment.html: great catch. The fielder had to run back from midwicket, dive and catch it over his shoulder. Guess who? It's Sikandar Raza, and he shows no tiredness in his legs as he leaps in the air and flings the ball up in celebration. The shot was on for Shahzad, as there was no one on the boundary, but his stroke was top edged.
Is this an opening for Zimbabwe?

dismissalText.commentary: Asghar Afghan b Williams 32 (60b 4x4 1x6 68m) SR: 53.33

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! Afghanistan are stumbling on the brink. Stanikzai played inside the line to one delivered from round the wicket, and it spun across him to hit the off stump.

headshotImage.caption: Tendai Chisoro player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tendai Chisoro player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Noor Ali Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Noor Ali Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: gone! Noor Ali responds with an aggressive swipe outside off, but he's cut the ball in the air and straight to Chigumbura in the covers. Chisoro bellows his celebration in the batsman's direction as Noor Ali trudges off. Finally, Zimbabwe break through, though Afghanistan are already in a great position.

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: great catch. The fielder had to run back from midwicket, dive and catch it over his shoulder. Guess who? It's Sikandar Raza, and he shows no tiredness in his legs as he leaps in the air and flings the ball up in celebration. The shot was on for Shahzad, as there was no one on the boundary, but his stroke was top edged.
Is this an opening for Zimbabwe?

great awareness from Ervine! He was at slip, but as Nawroz telegraphed his intentions to paddle-sweep he started to move behind the keeper. The ball popped up off the bat-handle/glove and Ervine found himself in the perfect position to hold an easy catch. Another wicket!
smart catch! Shafiqullah flicks, but in the air, and Ervine dives forward to hold it inches above the turf. He also did well to hold on as both elbows hit the ground.
bowled him! Afghanistan are stumbling on the brink. Stanikzai played inside the line to one delivered from round the wicket, and it spun across him to hit the off stump.

headshotImage.caption: Wellington Masakadza player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Wellington Masakadza player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Nabi c Masakadza b Jongwe 12 (16b 0x4 1x6 26m) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: there's a collision between the fielders, but Nabi is caught! He wanted to send this over the infield, with both mid on and mid off up, but top edged the stroke. Both Panyangara, at mid on, and Masakadza, at midwicket, wanted it. Masakadza set himself under the ball, and held the catch even as Panyangara bumped into him, knocking him over. But he shows good commitment to hold on, and Zimbabwe break through again. Is it too late?

headshotImage.longCaption: Wellington Masakadza player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Samiullah Shinwari c Ervine b Masakadza 10 (30b 0x4 0x6 36m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: off the splice, and it lobs easily to Ervine at slip! Shenwari was well forward, and the ball bounced more than he expected. Simple catch for the slip fielder, and Afghanistan lose another, on the brink of victory.

dismissalText.commentary: Shafiqullah c Ervine b Williams 4 (6b 1x4 0x6 4m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: smart catch! Shafiqullah flicks, but in the air, and Ervine dives forward to hold it inches above the turf. He also did well to hold on as both elbows hit the ground.

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: here's the game! Rashid draws Afghanistan level with a swipe over long off, the ball clearing the boundary by several metres.

commentPostTextItems.html: 4.30pm Afghanistan have overturned a low total by Zimbabwe, winning by three wickets with more than three overs to spare, but this chase has not been without its moments of alarm. They were cruising when Mohammad Shahzad was at the crease, but when he was dismissed for 80 the Zimbabwean spinners suddenly seemed to be bowling with much more menace. Afghanistan laboured over the latter stages of their chase, but the important thing is that they got over the line, and now it's 2-2 with one game to play! One can't help but wonder how much closer this game might have been had Zimbabwe's batsmen provided some support to Sikandar Raza to get the side over 200. Spin certainly played a leading role today, with scoring quite difficult this afternoon.
Mohammad Shahzad is Man of the Match for his 80 which set up Afghanistan's chase.

And there you have it. Suddenly there's everything to play for on Saturday. Your commentator today has been Liam Brickhill, and I'll be with you again on the weekend. Look out for my match report on this game in the next few minutes. I hope you've enjoyed my commentary, and please do join me again in two days' time. Cheerio!

commentTextItems.html: how has this not bowled him? The ball pitched outside leg, spun back to beat the sweep, but somehow missed the stumps as well.
crouching defence from the batsman.

commentPreTextItems.html: Six needed. One hit will do it!

commentTextItems.html: speared down on leg stump, turned to square leg.
solid forward defence, and Masakadza fields off his own bowling.

headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Wellington Masakadza player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Wellington Masakadza player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: tapped back just past the bowler, but mid on is quickly in.
tapped to mid off, who is very deep, so they rush through for one.
extended appeal for lbw! Wellington was convinced! But Umpire Matibiri turns him down.
off the pad, straight to square leg.
squeezed out to point, off the front foot.
pushed back to the bowler.

headshotImage.caption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Wellington Masakadza player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Wellington Masakadza player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: excitement in the field as he's hit on the pad, but it was headed down leg.
stretching defence from the batsman.
full outside off, and he drives to mid off.

commentPreTextItems.html: Dawlat marches quickly out to the middle. He'll want to have a go at the bowling.

commentTextItems.html: but not straight away. He's back and across to defend to midwicket.

dismissalText.commentary: Asghar Afghan b Williams 32 (60b 4x4 1x6 68m) SR: 53.33

commentTextItems.html: bowled him! Afghanistan are stumbling on the brink. Stanikzai played inside the line to one delivered from round the wicket, and it spun across him to hit the off stump.
flicked just behind square on the leg side, Stanikzai keeps strike.

headshotImage.longCaption: Wellington Masakadza player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: Stanikzai is forward to drive to extra cover.
past the edge! Hands on the head from the bowler.
tapped down to cover point, they think about the single but decide against it.

dismissalText.commentary: Richmond Mutumbami lbw b Dawlat Zadran 5 (18b 0x4 0x6 19m) SR: 27.77

dismissalComment.html: trapped in front! Mutumbami stayed at the crease, his feet didn't really go anywhere, and flicked across his front pad. There were two sounds, but I believe that was the ball hitting the front pad and and the back pad. A fairly straightforward decision for the umpire, and Afghanistan strike early!

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Mohammad Shahzad b Dawlat Zadran
dismissalText.commentary: Craig Ervine c Mohammad Shahzad b Dawlat Zadran 1 (9b 0x4 0x6 9m) SR: 11.11

dismissalComment.html: got him! After beating the bat twice, Dawlat has found the edge. Ervine wanted to drive again. The ball was up there for the shot, but the seam movement took it further away from him. The ball kissed the edge and nestled snuggly in Shahzad's gloves. Dawlat is embraced by his team mates as he pumps his fists in celebration.

dismissalText.long: c Nawroz Mangal b Amir Hamza
dismissalText.commentary: Sean Williams c Nawroz Mangal b Amir Hamza 11 (22b 0x4 1x6 27m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: chipped to mid off! Williams probably wanted to go straighter than this, but punched too early at the ball to present a simple catch to the mid off fielder.

headshotImage.caption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Chamu Chibhabha lbw b Rashid Khan 26 (32b 4x4 0x6 64m) SR: 81.25

dismissalComment.html: got him! This has been a lovely over from the young leggie. Again he hung this one in the breeze, and it drifted in deceptively. He expected it to pitch and turn, but it rushed straight on, and he'd played outside it. Umpire Nigel Llong upholds the appeal, and Zimbabwe are in serious trouble at 45 for 4.

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Elton Chigumbura run out (Shafiqullah/Mohammad Shahzad) 15 (46b 1x4 0x6 45m) SR: 32.6

dismissalComment.html: a needless run out! Raza tapped the ball just wide of mid on, but called immediately for the single. He was running to the danger end, so it was his call. Chigumbura must have heard the call, but he turned around and watched the ball instead of running. By the time he eventually set off, with Raza shouting for the single again, the ball was already being thrown to Shahzad. Ball-watching results in a run out.

image.caption: Tinotenda Mutombodzi at the Under-19 World Cup
image.longCaption: Tinotenda Mutombodzi at the Under-19 World Cup, January 2010

image.caption: Tinotenda Mutombodzi at the Under-19 World Cup
image.longCaption: Tinotenda Mutombodzi at the Under-19 World Cup, January 2010

headshotImage.caption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: st Mohammad Shahzad b Rashid Khan
dismissalText.commentary: Tinotenda Mutombodzi st Mohammad Shahzad b Rashid Khan 4 (9b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 44.44

dismissalComment.html: stumped! Tino came down the track, but the ball was really short and he couldn't get close to the pitch of it. There was sharp spin, away from the bat, and by the time he turned himself around Shahzad had smashed the stumps down. Another one goes, and Zimbabwe sink even further

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.long: c Samiullah Shinwari b Mohammad Nabi
dismissalText.commentary: Luke Jongwe c Samiullah Shinwari b Mohammad Nabi 22 (38b 1x4 0x6 61m) SR: 57.89

dismissalComment.html: slog swept out to deep midwicket! Well, he went for the shot straight away. The connection was alright, but it went too high and not far enough. The fielder settles under the high chance, and holds it cleanly.

dismissalText.long: c Samiullah Shinwari b Dawlat Zadran
dismissalText.commentary: Sikandar Raza c Samiullah Shinwari b Dawlat Zadran 86 (113b 5x4 1x6 133m) SR: 76.1

dismissalComment.html: sliced up high towards mid off, the fielder runs back, settles underneath it, and holds the catch. A brave knock comes to an end.

headshotImage.caption: Noor Ali Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Noor Ali Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Noor Ali Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Noor Ali Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Tendai Chisoro player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tendai Chisoro player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Noor Ali Zadran c Chigumbura b Chisoro 23 (53b 2x4 0x6 66m) SR: 43.39

dismissalComment.html: gone! Noor Ali responds with an aggressive swipe outside off, but he's cut the ball in the air and straight to Chigumbura in the covers. Chisoro bellows his celebration in the batsman's direction as Noor Ali trudges off. Finally, Zimbabwe break through, though Afghanistan are already in a great position.

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Tendai Chisoro player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tendai Chisoro player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Shahzad c Sikandar Raza b Chisoro 80 (81b 7x4 3x6 98m) SR: 98.76

dismissalComment.html: great catch. The fielder had to run back from midwicket, dive and catch it over his shoulder. Guess who? It's Sikandar Raza, and he shows no tiredness in his legs as he leaps in the air and flings the ball up in celebration. The shot was on for Shahzad, as there was no one on the boundary, but his stroke was top edged.
Is this an opening for Zimbabwe?

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

headshotImage.caption: Wellington Masakadza player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Wellington Masakadza player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Nabi c Masakadza b Jongwe 12 (16b 0x4 1x6 26m) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: there's a collision between the fielders, but Nabi is caught! He wanted to send this over the infield, with both mid on and mid off up, but top edged the stroke. Both Panyangara, at mid on, and Masakadza, at midwicket, wanted it. Masakadza set himself under the ball, and held the catch even as Panyangara bumped into him, knocking him over. But he shows good commitment to hold on, and Zimbabwe break through again. Is it too late?

headshotImage.caption: Tendai Chisoro player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tendai Chisoro player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Nawroz Mangal c Ervine b Chisoro 6 (17b 0x4 0x6 25m) SR: 35.29

dismissalComment.html: great awareness from Ervine! He was at slip, but as Nawroz telegraphed his intentions to paddle-sweep he started to move behind the keeper. The ball popped up off the bat-handle/glove and Ervine found himself in the perfect position to hold an easy catch. Another wicket!

dismissalText.commentary: Asghar Afghan b Williams 32 (60b 4x4 1x6 68m) SR: 53.33

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! Afghanistan are stumbling on the brink. Stanikzai played inside the line to one delivered from round the wicket, and it spun across him to hit the off stump.

headshotImage.caption: Wellington Masakadza player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Wellington Masakadza player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Samiullah Shinwari c Ervine b Masakadza 10 (30b 0x4 0x6 36m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: off the splice, and it lobs easily to Ervine at slip! Shenwari was well forward, and the ball bounced more than he expected. Simple catch for the slip fielder, and Afghanistan lose another, on the brink of victory.

dismissalText.commentary: Shafiqullah c Ervine b Williams 4 (6b 1x4 0x6 4m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: smart catch! Shafiqullah flicks, but in the air, and Ervine dives forward to hold it inches above the turf. He also did well to hold on as both elbows hit the ground.

headshotImage.caption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Rashid Khan not out 9 (11b 0x4 1x6 12m) SR: 81.81
Mirwais Ashraf not out 0 (7b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 0

notes: Drinks: Zimbabwe: 48 runs/ 4 wkts. after 18 overs, 4x4, 1x6,( Chigumbura 3, Sikandar 1)
Zim: 50 runs/ 4 wkts, after 19.4 overs, 4x4 1x6, 1 ex
Zimbabwe: 113 runs/ 6 wkts, after 37 overs, 1 ex, 8x4, 1x6, (Sikanda 42, Jongwe 8)
Sikandar R: 52 runs off 74 balls in 87 minutes, 4x4 1x6
1st wicket: 53 runs off 84 balls in 52 minutes, 6x4, 0x6, (Noor 19. Shahzad 30) 4ex
Drinks: Afghanistan: 72 runs/ 1 wkt, after 18 overs, 4ex, 6x4, 1x6, (Shahzad M 45, Mohammad N, 0)
M.Shahzad: 50 runs off 60 balls in 74 minutes, 4x4 1x6
Drinks: Afghanistan: 148 runs/ 4 wkts, after 36 overs, 8 ex, 12x4, 4x6.(Asghar 16, Samuillah 3 )

milestones.description: Dawlat Zadran has broken the record for most ducks (4) in ODIs for AFG, going past Nawroz Mangal's 4

stories.title: Zimbabwe v Afghanistan, 2015-16
stories.subTitle: 4th ODI, Bulawayo
stories.seoTitle: Wisden Almanack review: Zimbabwe v Afghanistan, 2015-16
stories.summary: Wisden's review of the fourth ODI, Zimbabwe v Afghanistan, 2015-16

stories.title: Shahzad 80 sets up series-levelling win
stories.subTitle: Zimbabwe v Afghanistan, 4th ODI, Bulawayo
stories.summary: Afghanistan leveled the series against Zimbabwe with a three-wicket win in the fourth one-day international at Queens Sports Club, with Mohammad Shahzad's 80 setting up their pursuit of Zimbabwe's 184
stories.byline: The Report by Liam Brickhill in Bulawayo

image.caption: Sikandar Raza limped his way to 86
image.longCaption: Sikandar Raza limped his way to 86, Zimbabwe v Afghanistan, 4th ODI, Bulawayo, October 22, 2015

stories.title: Brittle Afghanistan seek to stay alive
stories.subTitle: Zimbabwe v Afghanistan, 4th ODI, Bulawayo
stories.seoTitle: Brittle Afghanistan seek to stay alive
stories.summary: Zimbabwe's six-wicket win in the third ODI wasn't an accurate barometer of their dominance. The match would have been much tighter had Afghanistan made the most of their chances on the field

image.caption: Afghanistan get together after sealing victory
image.longCaption: Afghanistan get together after sealing victory, Zimbabwe v Afghanistan, 2nd ODI, Bulawayo, October 18, 2015

9.title: 3rd ODI
9.statusText: Zimbabwe won by 6 wickets (with 2 balls remaining)

40.statusText: Zimbabwe won by 6 wickets (with 2 balls remaining)

seriesNextMatches.statusText: Afghanistan won by 6 wickets (with 5 balls remaining)
